Ajit Vadakayil<br />\nJuly 23, 2015 at 9:46 PM<br />\nhi scr,<br />\n<br />\nevery single invention of the western man has been stolen from our ancient vedic texts.<br />\n<br />\nAryabhatta ( 2700 BC ) one of the top 5 mathematicians ever , lived in Kerala, as his astronomical calculations used a latitude near Calicut, my hometown. Max Mueller shoved back Aryabhatta by 2500 years.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/01/isaac-newton-calculus-thief-capt-ajit.html<br />\n<br />\nLogic is described by Kerala Namboodiri Chanakya (c. 350-283 BCE) in his Arthashastra.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/08/chanakya-taxila-university-professor.html<br />\n<br />\nGreeks talk about Pythagoras .Pythagoras was NOT even a mathematician.<br />\n<br />\nHe came to Kerala by ship all the way from Greece 2500 years ago, to cure his debilitating epilepsy .He hung around in the Kerala School of Math , without understanding anything.<br />\n<br />\n- but he had some notes with him and went back as the planet\u2019s No 1 mathematician , thinker and a vegetarian to boot.<br />\n<br />\nPythagoras theorem was too simple for Kerala Mathematicians . They could do the same thing via advanced Calculus and Spherical trigonometry and Algebra.<br />\n<br />\n100 years later Plato would come to Kerala by ship and learn for a few years . And then he went back as a greater cat than Pythagoras\u2014 he was now the planet\u2019s No 1 THINKER !<br />\n<br />\nBoth Pythagoras and Plato had NOTHING original to offer to this planet \u2014 other than what they stole and patented in their own names . Greek Plato ( 427BC-347 BC ) also went back from Kerala as a Mathematician ( he was smarter than Pythogoras ) and a philosopher.<br />\n<br />\nHe shared his spoils with his mentor Socrates, and fellow homosexual side kick Aristotle ( 384 BC- 322 BC ) and got himself immortalized as the founder of the Academy in Athens, the first institution of higher learning in the Western world.<br />\n<br />\nSocrates and Plato were hardcore homosexuals<br />\n<br />\nThis gruesome HOMOSEXUAL TRIO of Plato, Socrates and Aristotle laid the foundations of Western philosophy and science with stolen and patented knowledge .<br />\n<br />\nThe history of fourfold negation, the Catuskoti (Sanskrit), is evident in the logico-epistemological tradition of the 7000 year old Upanishads.<br />\n<br />\nP; that is, being.<br />\nnot P; that is, not being.<br />\nP and not P; that is, being and not being.<br />\nnot (P or not P); that is, neither being nor not being.<br />\n<br />\nThe catu\u1e63ko\u1e6di is a \"four-cornered\" system of argumentation that involves the systematic examination and rejection of each of the 4 possibilities of a proposition,<br />\n<br />\nAll things (dharmas) exist: affirmation of being, negation of nonbeing<br />\nAll things (dharmas) do not exist: affirmation of nonbeing, negation of being<br />\nAll things (dharmas) both exist and do not exist: both affirmation and negation<br />\nAll things (dharmas) neither exist nor do not exist: neither affirmation nor negation<br />\n<br />\nTHERE IS A BIG DIFFERENCE BETWEEN INVENTIONS AND INNOVATION.<br />\n<br />\nNIKOLA TESLA WAS AN INVENTOR<br />\n<br />\nSTEVE JOBS WAS AN INNOVATOR WHO HAD AN ARMY OF BRAINS WORKING UNDER HIM.<br />\n<br />\nMary Everest Boole , the wife of George Boole had written that her husband used the Vedic sutras and the laws of Panini.<br />\n<br />\nSame way Dimitri Mendeleyeev had admitted in writing that his PERIODIC TABLE is lifted from the Sanskrit alphabets of Panini.<br />\n<br />\nGeorge Boole and Augustus De Morgan make their pioneering applications of algebraic ideas to the formulation of logic (such as Algebraic logic and Boolean logic), from the Vedic sutras written down 7000 years ago.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_19BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_19b+seedEaD1D\" kind=\"d\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-thread inline-thread\" id=\"bc_0_17T\" kind=\"t\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; margin: 8px 0px; padding: 0.5em 1em;\" t=\"0\" u=\"0\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_19b+seedEaD1D\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_17TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_17TN\"></span></span></span><br />\n<div class=\"thread-dropContainer thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_17TD\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_19b+seedEaD1D\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_17TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_17TN\"><span class=\"thread-drop\"></span></span></span></span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_19b+seedEaD1D\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_17TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_17TN\">\n</span></span><br />\n</span><br />\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_17TC\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\"><span id=\"bc_0_19b+seedEaD1D\" kind=\"d\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_17B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c5872728746587817292\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_17M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2010/11/sanskrit-digital-language-versus-versus.html?showComment=1437668700830#c5872728746587817292\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">July 23, 2015 at 9:55 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_17MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCapt. Ajit Vadakayil<br />\nJuly 23, 2015 at 9:48 PM<br />\nCONTINUED FROM 1-<br />\nBy combining Boolean logic with ancient Vedic mathematics, substantial amount of iteration were eliminated that resulted in 45% reduction in delay and 30% reduction in power compared with the mostly used (Digit Recurrence, Convergence &amp; Series Expansion) architectures<br />\n<br />\nSulba Sutra dictates the rules spelled out in this text require the construction of various shapes of the Vedic fire altars that will occupy the same space. The earlier Vedic Fire altars required five layers of bricks and each layer consisting 200 burnt bricks, and each layers will be in the perfect harmony of each other.<br />\n<br />\nThis may look to be a simple math problem but without using Trigonometry it is hard to construct the rule based fire altars .<br />\n<br />\nSulba Sutra clearly defines the numerology associated with altar by giving examples of simple Pythagorean triples, such as: (3, 4, 5), (5, 12, 13), (8, 15, 17), (7, 24, 25),and (12, 35, 37), as well verbalization of the Pythagorean theorem for the sides of a square without expressing into a mathematical formula. \"The rope which is stretched across the diagonal of a square produces an area double the size of the original square\u201d<br />\n<br />\nPanini\u2019s grammar includes early use of Boolean logic, of the null operator, and of context free grammars, and includes a precursor of the \u201cBackus\u2013Naur\u201d form (used in the description programming languages) .<br />\n<br />\nPanini lived 7500 years ago. The white invader kicked him forward in time as the Big Bang of the bible was only in 4004 BC.<br />\n<br />\nBoolean Algebra served the basis of early transistors and capacitors used in early primitive form of the computer.<br />\n<br />\nRoger Pot Droit-1949 French writer and Philosopher: \"The Greeks Loved So Much Indian Philosophy that Demetrio Galliano had even translated the Bhagavad-Gita. There is not a shadow of the doubt that the Greeks knew all about Indian Philosophy.\u201d<br />\n<br />\nNow let me digress from COW and DHARMA \u2013 to convince the skeptic western mind \u2014NOT that I care. They can all FUCK themselves for all i care.<br />\n<br />\nThere are seven basic logic gates: AND, OR, XOR, NOT, NAND, NOR, and XNOR.<br />\n<br />\nThe AND gate is so named because, if 0 is called \"false\" and 1 is called \"true,\" the gate acts in the same way as the logical \"and\" operator The output is \"true\" when both inputs are \"true.\" Otherwise, the output is \"false.\"<br />\n<br />\nThe OR gate gets its name from the fact that it behaves after the fashion of the logical inclusive \"or.\" The output is \"true\" if either or both of the inputs are \"true.\" If both inputs are \"false,\" then the output is \"false.\"<br />\n<br />\nThe XOR ( exclusive-OR ) gate acts in the same way as the logical \"either/or.\" The output is \"true\" if either, but not both, of the inputs are \"true.\" The output is \"false\" if both inputs are \"false\" or if both inputs are \"true.\" Another way of looking at this circuit is to observe that the output is 1 if the inputs are different, but 0 if the inputs are the same.<br />\n<br />\nA logical inverter , sometimes called a NOT gate to differentiate it from other types of electronic inverter devices, has only one input. It reverses the logic state.<br />\n<br />\nThe NAND gate operates as an AND gate followed by a NOT gate. It acts in the manner of the logical operation \"and\" followed by negation. The output is \"false\" if both inputs are \"true.\" Otherwise, the output is \"true.\"<br />\n<br />\nThe NOR gate is a combination OR gate followed by an inverter. Its output is \"true\" if both inputs are \"false.\" Otherwise, the output is \"false.\"<br />\n<br />\nThe XNOR (exclusive-NOR) gate is a combination XOR gate followed by an inverter. Its output is \"true\" if the inputs are the same, and\"false\" if the inputs are different.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 3-<br />\n<br />\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_18B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c7251371065291391171\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_18MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 2-<br />\n<br />\nUsing combinations of logic gates, complex operations can be performed. In theory, there is no limit to the number of gates that can be arrayed together in a single device. But in practice, there is a limit to the number of gates that can be packed into a given physical space. Arrays of logic gates are found in digital integrated circuits (ICs).<br />\n<br />\nAs IC technology advances, the required physical volume for each individual logic gate decreases and digital devices of the same or smaller size become capable of performing ever-more-complicated operations at ever-increasing speeds. Urdhava Tiryakbhyam is a Sanskrit word which means vertically defined as urdhavya and crosswise as triyakbhayam in English.<br />\n<br />\nThe method is a general multiplication formula applicable to all cases of multiplication examples. It is based on a novel &amp; rudimentary concept through which all kind of partial products are generated concurrently.<br />\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lVZlMBP658A<br />\n<br />\nPythagoras came to India as a student; but when he left he left as a great teacher. As per Greek history Pythagoras spent 22 years away from home mastering Vedic mathematics, Indian astronomy, Indian music, Hindu mysticism, Yoga, various religious doctrines and philosophy of Yoga<br />\n<br />\nFollowing is a quote from Greek texts-<br />\nQUOTE: Pythagoras became a sworn vegetarian and practiced fasting and Yoga (Standing on one leg).. After his return back, Pythagoras confided to a friend\u201cI am a different man, I am reborn. Through this purification, my center of being has changed. Now truth is not a concept to me, but a life.\" He was 56 years old when he returned home, his home, schools and temples were in ruins due to past Persian invasions. He did not feel welcomed by his friends and neighbors, so he went to southern Italy settling down in city called Crotona and impressed the people over there with his wisdom, so they decided to build an institute which would serve as a school of science, Vedic philosophy and astronomy. There was nothing about the place suggesting any secrecy , since he make sure that the statue of Hermes Trismegistus stood at the inside of the entrance to the school with the words on the pedestal: \"Let no profane enter here.\" He also taught the philosophy, yoga, asceticism, breathing exercise and knowledge of healing through roots and herbs that he had learned from Indians. UNQUOTE<br />\n<br />\nThe tetralemma is lifted from ancient Indian math.<br />\nIt states that with reference to any a logical proposition X, there are four possibilities:<br />\n<br />\nX (affirmation)<br />\n\\neg X (negation)<br />\nX \\land \\neg X (both) equiv.<br />\n\\neg (X \\lor \\neg X) (neither)<br />\n<br />\nShashi Tharoor talked about weavers and looms at Oxford.<br />\n<br />\nI would have preferred that he was a bit more cerebral than \u201cmundanely melodramatic\u201d.<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_19b+seedEaD1D\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_19b+seedEaD1D\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Like Hebrew the Arabic\nscript was created by Kerala Namboodiris \u2013 RIGHT TO LEFT.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pythagoras and Plato\nstudied in Kodungallur University of Kerala.&nbsp;&nbsp;\n&nbsp;Same way several Persian scholars\nstudied Math, astrology and science in Kerala <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arabic language was\ncreated by Kerala Namboodiris. , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Persian\nMathematician Muhammad ibn Musa al-Khwarizmi studied in Kodungallur University\nin Kerala.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let me quote wikipedia:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE- <i>Ibn al-Nad\u012bm's\nKit\u0101b al-Fihrist includes a short biography on al-Khw\u0101rizm\u012b together with a\nlist of the books he wrote. Al-Khw\u0101rizm\u012b accomplished most of his work in the\nperiod between 813 and 833. After the Muslim conquest of Persia, Baghdad became\nthe centre of scientific studies and trade, and many merchants and scientists\nfrom as far as China and India traveled to this city, as did al-Khw\u0101rizm\u012b. He\nworked in Baghdad as a scholar at the House of Wisdom established by Caliph\nal-Ma\u2019m\u016bn, where he studied the sciences and mathematics, which included the\ntranslation of Greek and Sanskrit scientific manuscripts.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Al-Khw\u0101rizm\u012b's Z\u012bj\nal-Sindhind[11] (Arabic: \u0632\u064a\u062c \u0627\u0644\u0633\u0646\u062f \u0647\u0646\u062f\u200e, \"astronomical tables of Sindh and\nHind\") is a work consisting of approximately 37 chapters on calendrical\nand astronomical calculations and 116 tables with calendrical, astronomical and\nastrological data, as well as a table of sine values. This is the first of many\nArabic Zijes based on the Indian astronomical methods known as the\nsindhind.[22] The work contains tables for the movements of the sun, the moon\nand the five planets known at the time. This work marked the turning point in\nIslamic astronomy. Hitherto, Muslim astronomers had adopted a primarily\nresearch approach to the field, translating works of others and learning\nalready discovered knowledge.</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">-UNQUOTE <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Muhammad_ibn_Musa_al-Khwarizmi\">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Muhammad_ibn_Musa_al-Khwarizmi</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE: <i>Al-Biruni wrote\nan encyclopedic work on India called \u201cTarikh Al-Hind\u201d (History of India) in\nwhich he explored nearly every aspect of Indian life, including religion,\nhistory, geography, geology, science, and mathematics. My book is nothing but a\nsimple historic record of facts. I shall place before the reader the theories\nof the Hindus exactly as they are, and I shall mention in connection with them\nsimilar theories of the Greeks in order to show the relationship existing\nbetween them.(1910, Vol. 1, p. 7;1958, p. 5)<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Hindus considered\nMuslims violent and impure, and did not want to share anything with him.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Over time, Al-Biruni\nwon the welcome of Hindu scholars. Al-Biruni collected books and studied with\nthese Hindu scholars to become fluent in Sanskrit, discover and translate into\nArabic the mathematics, science, medicine, astronomy and other fields of arts\nas practiced in 11th century India. He was inspired by the arguments offered by\nIndian scholars who believed earth must be ellipsoid shape, with yet to be\ndiscovered continent at earth's south pole, and earth's rotation around the sun\nis the only way to fully explain the difference in daylight hours by latitude,\nseasons and earth's relative positions with moon and stars.[36] Al-Biruni was\nalso critical of Indian scribes who he believed carelessly corrupted Indian\ndocuments while making copies of older documents.[37] Al-Biruni's translations\nas well as his own original contributions reached Europe in 12th and 13th\ncentury, where they were actively sought.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>While others were\nkilling each other over religious differences, Al-Biruni had a remarkable\nability to engage Hindus in peaceful dialogue. Mohammad Yasin puts this\ndramatically when he says, \u201cThe Indica is like a magic island of quiet,\nimpartial research in the midst of a world of clashing swords, burning towns,\nand burned temples.\u201d (Indica is another name for Al-Biruni\u2019s history of India).\n(Yasin, 1975, p. 212).</i> :UNQUOTE <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al-Biruni\">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al-Biruni</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>ANCIENT ARABS AND\nGREEKS DO NOT HAVE A SINGLE INVENTION OR DISCOVERY repeat NOT A SINGLE\nINVENTION OR DISCOVERY , WHICH IS NOT STOLEN FROM INDIA&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">.. . , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ibn Sina ( Avicenna died\n1037 AD ) studied math, astrology , Ayurveda and surgery in Kodungallur University.\n&nbsp;These Islamic scholars never went to\nNorth India as the Brahmins distrusted the foreigner Muslims and looked upon\nthem as violent and lacking in character.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let me quote Wikipedia \u2013<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Of the 450 works he is\nknown to have written, around 240 have survived, including 150 on philosophy\nand 40 on medicine.[6]<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">His most famous works\nare The Book of Healing \u2013 a philosophical and scientific encyclopedia, and The\nCanon of Medicine \u2013 a medical encyclopedia[7][8][9] which became a standard\nmedical text at many medieval universities[10] and remained in use as late as 1650.[11]\nIn 1973, Avicenna's Canon Of Medicine was reprinted in New York.[12]<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Besides philosophy and\nmedicine, Avicenna's corpus includes writings on astronomy, alchemy, geography\nand geology, psychology, Islamic theology, logic, mathematics, physics and poetry.[13]<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Ibn Sina created an\nextensive corpus of works during what is commonly known as the Islamic Golden\nAge, in which the translations of Greco-Roman, Persian, and Indian texts were\nstudied extensively.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Greco-Roman (Mid- and Neo-Platonic, and Aristotelian)\ntexts translated by the Kindi school &nbsp;( AL KINDI STUDIED IN KODUNGALLUR UNIVERSITY ) were commented, redacted and developed\nsubstantially by Islamic intellectuals, who also built upon Persian and Indian\nmathematical systems, astronomy, algebra, trigonometry and medicine.[14]<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Aruzi Samarqandi\ndescribes how before Avicenna left Khwarezm he had met Al-Biruni (a famous\nscientist and astronomer), Abu Nasr Iraqi (a renowned mathematician), Abu Sahl\nMasihi (a respected philosopher) and Abu al-Khayr Khammar (a great physician).(\nALL OF THEM STUDIED IN KODUNGALLUR UNIVERSITY )<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">According to his\nautobiography, Avicenna had memorised the entire Quran by the age of 10.[23] He\nlearned Indian arithmetic from an Indian green grocer,\u0621Mahmoud Massahi[24] and\nhe began to learn more from a wandering scholar who gained a livelihood by\ncuring the sick and teaching the young. As a teenager, he was greatly troubled\nby the Metaphysics of Aristotle, ( LIFTED FROM INDIA ) which he could not\nunderstand until he read al-Farabi's commentary on the work.[17]</span> UNQUOTE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IBN SINA ( AVICENNA )\nGOT MOST OF HIS INDIAN KNOWLEDGE FROM THE GRAND LIBRARY OF THE SAMANID EMIR , NUR\nIBN MANSUR WHO FELL ILL .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IBN SINA KEPT\nTHIS A SECRET TO SHOW WHAT A GREAT CAT HE IS.&nbsp;&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>IBN SINA WOULD NEVER\nTOLERATE A CHARGE THAT HE HAD NOTHING ORIGINAL OF HIS OWN AND THAT HIS ENTIRE\nBOOKS CONTENT ARE JUST STOLEN FROM INDIA.&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You must read his book where he spills\nvitriol on an intellectual rival, who charged him of plaigiarism and lack of\ncharacter \u201c On the Reprimants of a Feces-Eater\u201d. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No intellectual will write such a book\u2014only low\nclass thieves will do this. His own father was an embezelling accountant ( who took his own son with him to cook up accounts ) &nbsp;\u2013 no wonder.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IBN SINAs BOOKS ON\nMEDICINE KEEPS HARPING ABOUT AYURVEDIC KAPHA , PITTA , VATA HUMORS.&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;MOST\nOF IT IS JUST WORD BY WORD LIFTED FROM GREEK GALEN ( DIED 216 AD ) WHO STUDIED SUSRUTA\nSURGERY IN KODUNGALLUR UNIVERSITY.&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">IBN SINA ALSO LIFTED\nEXTENSIVELY FROM GREEK HIPPOCRATES <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Hippocrates added some\nBULL over and above what he learnt in Kerala and Ibn Sena wrote the same thing\u2014ditto\u2014this\nis how knowledge thieves get caught.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Example :<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">In Ayurvedic medicine,\nthere are 3 basic temperaments: Vata (gas), Pitta (bile) and Kapha (phlegm).<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Hippocrates ( 460BC-\n370 BC ) threw in one more most STUPID item ( blood\u2014TEE HEEE ) into the\nworks.&nbsp; For in the Sushruta Samhita, it\nis stated that blood ( Rakta ) , is a DHATU&nbsp;\nin Ayurveda.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">So his fudged treatise\ntalks about - bilious (bile), sanguineous (blood),&nbsp; phlegmatic (phlegm) and atrabiliary (black\nbile).&nbsp; And he removed Vata ( gas ) \u2013the\nmost important one.&nbsp; Show what an amazing\nidiot he is.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Hippocrates the thief\ndid several more spins in medicine-- that body is made of water, air, earth and\nfire.&nbsp; He left out vaccum of Ayurveda .\nIn the Ayurvedic system, body is made of water, air, earth, fire and vacuum.\nDigestion is explained as cooking of food with the help of body-fire.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Hippocrates theory that\nthe human body is a microcosm of the universe is lifted from Ayurveda/\nUpanishads .<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Information about\nHippocrates can also be found in the writings of Aristotle, which date from the\n4th century BC.&nbsp; All newly qualified\ndoctors take what is called the \u2018Hippocratic Oath\u2019- NOT knowing that he is NOT\nworth to take an oath on.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Noting that Pythagoras\ngot himself healed of Epilepsy, Hippocrates was absolutely cock sure of stating\nthat epilepsy is NOT created by the Greek gods- and that like for every other\nillnesses it had a natural cause.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Stupid Hippocrates\nwrote that raw food is bad.&nbsp; Cant blame\nhim, after all it was his grandfather who received third party stolen stuff. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Hippocrates mistook the\nAyurvedic word&nbsp; AMA.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">The Ayurvedic word for\ntoxins, ama, means, \"crude\" or \"raw\" - residues from faulty\nor incomplete pepsis that haven't been properly integrated into the body and\nits functioning, and therefore impede it.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>If Zakir Naik got any\nmore <span style=\"color: red;\">HUM BHI MUSLIM TUM BHI MUSLIM</span> foreigners heroes ( ALL BULL HURRR types &nbsp;) &nbsp;let\nme know\u2014 &nbsp;I will derive great pleaYYure in\ndismantling them.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><b>WHAT DO YOU CALL A MUSLIM MAN WHO GIVES AWAY HIS OWN WATANs INTELLECTUAL RIGHTS TO A MUSLIM FOREIGNER &nbsp;?</b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Al Kindi ( pagan Kindi\ntribe ) had NOTHING original from his own mind\u2014 every single thing was lifted (\nrather translated authorless works \u2013affixed with own name ) and patented <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Positive\nthinking, which is an oft quoted phrase in the law of attraction, finds its\nroots in Sanatana Dharma. &nbsp;&nbsp;Happiness,\naccording to Hinduism, does not mean wealth or power, but a sense of bliss ,\npeace and a feeling of completeness.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092d\u0935\u0924\u093f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0964\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nothing is higher than\nDharma. The weak overcomes the stronger by Dharma, as over a king. Truly that\nDharma is the Truth (Satya); Therefore, when a man speaks the Truth, they say,\n\"He speaks the Dharma\"; and if he speaks Dharma, they say, \"He\nspeaks the Truth!\" For both are one.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2014<b>\u2009Brihadaranyaka\nUpanishad, 1.4.xiv 5000 BC</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Both Hinduism and the law of attraction\nposit the concept of spiritual unity. Spiritual unity points to mental\nintegrity. The mind should be absolutely clear of its mission and this should correspond\nin the actions. &nbsp;The mind, according to both Hinduism and the law of attraction,\nshould be able to withstand all external disturbances and remain focused on\nwhat it wants to achieve.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sanatana Dharma has\nexpounded on the laws of rhythm ( RTA ) and the laws of change . Time is NOT\nlinear but a cyclical spiral.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once the srishti or the\nuniverse was created, it fell into a rhythm or pattern. Matter can neither be\ncreated nor destroyed. What takes birth has to die and then re-emerge. Day and\nnight, good and evil and the seasons, all follow a rhythm. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is an incessant\ncycle of creation, preservation and dissolution. Srishti, sthiti, laya\nrepresented creation, preservation and dissolution. &nbsp;Classical dancers &nbsp;did amazing formations to depict the trinity\ngods who created, mediated and destroyed seamlessly . They depicted Shiva with\nthe damru, beating change. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-rL4p4183aeg/Vyyt6Hze3cI/AAAAAAABIIc/Q31LiTkWc3IRPCBMuWF1cxmhbJBXkMevACLcB/s1600/_DSC45c32.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"330\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-rL4p4183aeg/Vyyt6Hze3cI/AAAAAAABIIc/Q31LiTkWc3IRPCBMuWF1cxmhbJBXkMevACLcB/s640/_DSC45c32.JPG\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The laws of the\nuniverse came alive in subtle dance movements-- the cosmic dance of opposite\nforces , which sustains this universe\u2014the perfect tango of dynamic balance\nwhere one polar opposite changes into another smoothly and constantly .\u2014Shiva and\nShakti creating the cosmos \u2013 the 108 mudras of the Sri Yantra &nbsp;containing the theory of evertyhing \u2013the magic\nof Shabda Brahman \u2013the melody of the cosmos \u2013 divine vibrations of nada yoga - macrocosmic\nuniverse as a projection of sound vibrations\u2014<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-WqnsoCT_TY4/VyytbY0BtNI/AAAAAAABIIY/StU4FlLl-sUrkP-Bg7Yw_h6zIkW5T_7ewCLcB/s1600/stotrasm%2B3.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"562\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-WqnsoCT_TY4/VyytbY0BtNI/AAAAAAABIIY/StU4FlLl-sUrkP-Bg7Yw_h6zIkW5T_7ewCLcB/s640/stotrasm%2B3.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our classical dances\nshowcased mindboggling cosmic phenomenon. &nbsp;The white men with shallow and petty minds minds\ncalled us savages <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b>Today we see on TV\nJhalak dance programs , specially chosen &nbsp;halfwit\njudges, Hindu hating , &nbsp;watan loathing &nbsp;pathetic &nbsp;wannabe\ngoragaands \u2014 &nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b>--they see merit only in flashing\nbare ass,&nbsp; acrobatics, gymnastcs, trapeze, rotating on head &nbsp;and ridiculous tiptoing .&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hollering though a pursed throat is called classical\nsinging- they get so moved that these judges shed fake tears &nbsp;.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rothschild propagated\nthe AGAMA branch to drive a wedge into Hinduism using Kanchi mutt .&nbsp; In Kerala we never heard of Agama Hinduism\ntill the white invader came to India. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No Agama manuscript of\nany importance is found even in Varanasi , the greatest center of Hindu\nreligion, Sanskrit studies and culture-- or in any of the 4 original Hindu mutts\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Agama Shastras are not\npart of the Vedas. The Agamas do not derive their authority directly from the\nVedas. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Agama methods are worship of images of God\nthrough elaborate ridiculous rituals monopolized by Brahmins who did NOT know Sanskrit<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/04/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/04/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-bNZKLvgABP4/VyDP0xuJn-I/AAAAAAABH6Y/_A4VqbwK9_Af9NWx4r6rkelAnE2hv8_OwCLcB/s1600/525779e2feb6f5f1923c2c7F600638a8c.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em;
