font-size: x-large;\">TRAITOR </span><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: 12pt;\">WAS THE REASON WHY INDIA BECAME SLAVES FOR 800 YEARS . &nbsp;</span></b></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><b><br /></b></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">THE FATHER OF A PRINCESS WHO ELOPED , &nbsp;</span><span style=\"color: red;\">INVITED A GOONDA </span><span style=\"color: blue;\">TO KILL HER HUSBAND -- HE GAVE AWAY THE SECRETS OF THE PASS TO INVADER MOHAMMAD GHORI.</span></b></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/11/first-supari-and-turning-point-of.html\" style=\"background-color: yellow;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/11/first-supari-and-turning-point-of.html</a><o:p></o:p><br />\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 200%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-_ZpvsW8uVbM/VwyiFt9YZ0I/AAAAAAABHWQ/ktfLK6fIQYANALxB1lyTa-GJYxFBKFUEgCLcB/s1600/temporary50ed2a10e6d3b9ms2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-_ZpvsW8uVbM/VwyiFt9YZ0I/AAAAAAABHWQ/ktfLK6fIQYANALxB1lyTa-GJYxFBKFUEgCLcB/s1600/temporary50ed2a10e6d3b9ms2.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Below: Bholan pass in 1838 -- unwanted invaders get killed here or lost. &nbsp;Horses had to swim certain lengths- and they would be ambushed from a height by arrows &nbsp;and plain stones &nbsp;.</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 200%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-zOAzOLXYoaQ/Vwy3vf-9q7I/AAAAAAABHWg/Ha0-tMnDIRgUOxTr_hcmwCZe4zRFIQ1JACLcB/s1600/dowEEnload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"467\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-zOAzOLXYoaQ/Vwy3vf-9q7I/AAAAAAABHWg/Ha0-tMnDIRgUOxTr_hcmwCZe4zRFIQ1JACLcB/s640/dowEEnload.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 200%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-QGPIhzepMy0/Vwy37rWXKzI/AAAAAAABHWk/EvABfFI6z3stznyssS22_CvMq4BJLSQagCLcB/s1600/bolayn-pass.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-QGPIhzepMy0/Vwy37rWXKzI/AAAAAAABHWk/EvABfFI6z3stznyssS22_CvMq4BJLSQagCLcB/s640/bolayn-pass.jpg\" width=\"433\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">Above: In certain areas only one horse could pass.</span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">Below: Nobody dared to transit 54 kilometer Khyer pass without a guide-- you will die 100%&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 200%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-s3rzjK5_zFg/Vwy5DazLoNI/AAAAAAABHWw/LcKxRoBvezk-uiEQ7KfNxJaox1FdlNSGwCLcB/s1600/Ali_Musjid%252C_Khydber_Pass.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"418\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-s3rzjK5_zFg/Vwy5DazLoNI/AAAAAAABHWw/LcKxRoBvezk-uiEQ7KfNxJaox1FdlNSGwCLcB/s640/Ali_Musjid%252C_Khydber_Pass.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 200%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-q8TIOARZP1I/Vwy5wF4AGXI/AAAAAAABHW4/GuF1TeT--UsyNgpgEQ2l0pOpuSu_LjzMQCLcB/s1600/imesages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"425\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-q8TIOARZP1I/Vwy5wF4AGXI/AAAAAAABHW4/GuF1TeT--UsyNgpgEQ2l0pOpuSu_LjzMQCLcB/s640/imesages.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Above : &nbsp; Inhospitable HINDU KHUSH mountains &nbsp;-- even today KHUD KHUSHI is called suicide. &nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 200%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-TrN1sXW7MsU/Vwy6kNdPbnI/AAAAAAABHXE/wUMq-jQHOfYrCKA_GVHbnJchsSf5m5VlgCLcB/s1600/hindu_kuDsh_m.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"426\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-TrN1sXW7MsU/Vwy6kNdPbnI/AAAAAAABHXE/wUMq-jQHOfYrCKA_GVHbnJchsSf5m5VlgCLcB/s640/hindu_kuDsh_m.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Above: &nbsp;Attempting to reach ANCIENT India without a guide was khud khushi&nbsp;</span></span>&nbsp;--&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">-- &nbsp;most of the time low clouds enveloped treacherous paths . &nbsp; </span>&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: medium;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: medium;\"><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">Below: Kakasha tribe of Hindu Khush.</b></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 200%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-1W80QNNQhSE/Vwy8K_RNIMI/AAAAAAABHXQ/0lVFSo6FUz4bGrGuKadHQ3WbCYREkNwWACLcB/s1600/987907-PKrinakalavshwomen-1447055610-662-640x480.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-1W80QNNQhSE/Vwy8K_RNIMI/AAAAAAABHXQ/0lVFSo6FUz4bGrGuKadHQ3WbCYREkNwWACLcB/s640/987907-PKrinakalavshwomen-1447055610-662-640x480.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/08/the-lost-tribe-of-kalasha-capt-ajit.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/08/the-lost-tribe-of-kalasha-capt-ajit.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Damisa wrote that Apollonius went to visit Taxila with a Taxila deputed Namboodiri professor guide on CAMEL from Muziris.<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></b></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cApollonius took up his\nresidence in the temple of Aesculapius at Aegae in the company of the priests,\nmanifesting an amazing eagerness to acquire their secret knowledge, and had an\nastonishing gift for healing and clairvoyance\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Apollonius's attention\nwas drawn to India, the fountain-head of Wisdom. Five centuries previously,\nPythagoras had brought some of the Indian wisdom to Greece. But its memory had\nalmost vanished. The world was in need of a new emissary of the eastern\nmasters. Apollonius believed that he was called to perform such a mission; and\nso he set out, accompanied only by his friend and disciple, Damis, on the long\nand perilous trip to the Himalayas, following the same route formerly traversed\nby Pythagoras when he traveled to India on a similar mission five hundred years\nbefore\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThis was revealed to\nApollonius at a half-abandoned temple of Daphnaean Apollo some distance from\nAntioch, where a peasant-priest brought him the temple treasure, which had been\npreserved by tradition, handed down from father to son. This consisted of some\nsheets of copper on which were figures and diagrams. The priest had zealously\npreserved them till that moment; awaiting the arrival of the man worthy to\nreceive this gift\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cWhile engaged in his\nearly morning devotions in the light of the rising sun, the priest gave\nApollonius the copper sheets, which, as a Pythagorean, he was able to decipher\nas a record of his Master's journey to India, including the deserts and high\nmountains to be crossed before he reached the river in which elephants disport\nthemselves. He also saw before him a description of the exact spot which he had\nto reach (in trans-Himalayan Tibet), and of the monastery among the thousands\nof monasteries in the Far East where, five centuries previously, Pythagoras had\nstudied at the feet of the same Masters who were soon to become his teachers\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For Apollonius was to\nbecome their new western emissary, as Pythagoras had been five centuries\npreviously.*<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cAfter they had spent\nsome time with the magi of Babylon and conversed with them, the two travelers,\nApollonius and Damis, climbed mountains whose summits were veiled in the\nclouds. Unaffected by the gradual unfolding of their snowy immensities,\nApollonius said \"When the soul is without blemish it can rise far above\nthe highest mountains.\" (into the higher spiritual planes). They crossed\nthe Indus and came across kings clothed in white who despised ostentation. One\nevening, on a lonely river bank, they came on a brass stele inscribed with the\nwords; \"Here Alexander halted.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cComing into the land\nof elephants, (India), nomads offered Apollonius date wine, which he refused,\nthough he did not forbid Damis to take it, just as he did not refuse him to eat\nflesh, not wishing to impose his will on his disciple; however, he himself\nabstained from both\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cComing to the court of\nPhroates, King of Taxila, Apollonius was hospitably received by this vegetarian\nemperor who led a Pythagorean life except for his mild use of wine. When he\ntried to argue with Apollonius concerning the benefits of the moderate use of\nwine, saying that it promotes restful sleep, Apollonius, defended his\nwater-drinking, saying it preserves the soul untroubled and makes true\ndivination (clairvoyance) through dreams possible, with which wine interferes.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cFollowing the course\nof the Ganges, they climbed more hills and mountains (the Himalayas), and when\nthey were eighteen days' march from the Ganges, they saw in the middle of a\nplateau (Tibet) high in the mountains, the home of the wise men, which had the\nsame elevation as the Acropolis at Athens. A strange fog hovered over the\nplace, and on the rocks surrounding it were the imprints of men who appeared to\nhave fallen in an attempt to scale the heights, for an almost perpendicular\nascent was necessary at this point.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThen a young Indian\napproached the travelers, and coming over to Apollonius, speaking in perfect\nGreek, he told him to halt and follow him upwards, saying the Masters were\nexpecting their arrival and had commanded him to go to receive the visitors.\nApollonius and Damis were then led by their guide towards the community of\nBrahman sages dwelling on the Himalayan heights, whose chief was IARCHUS.\nPhilostratus described these sages as \"Brahmans who dwell on the earth,\nand yet are not on the earth; in places fortified, and yet without walls; and\nwho possess nothing and yet all things.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(*From de Beauvoir\nPreiaulaux, in his \"The Indian Travels of Apollonius of Tyana,\" we\ngather the following facts about these Brahmans , whom he describes as a race\nsuperior to the rest of mankind. He writes: \"The Brahman's education began\neven in his mother's womb. During the period of gestation she was soothed by\nsong and chants in praise of continence, which in proportion as they won her\npleased attention, beneficially influenced her future offspring. After the\nchild's birth, and as it grew in years, it was passed from one preceptor to\nanother, until it was old enough to become an auditor of the philosophers.\nThese lived frugally, abstained from animal food and women, and in a grove\noutside the city spent their days in earnest discourse, communicating their\nknowledge to all who chose to listen. But in their presence, the novice was not\npermitted to speak, or spit, under the penalty of one day's banishment from\ntheir society. At the age of thirty-seven, his student life ceased\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"The mountain\nBrahmans subsist on fruit and cow's curd with herbs. The others live on the\nfruit trees which are found in plenty near the river and which afford an almost\nconstant succession of fresh fruits, and, should these fail, on the self-sown wild\nrice that grows there. To eat any other food, or even touch animal food, they\nheld to be the height of impiety and uncleanliness. Each man has his own cabin,\nand lives as much as he can by himself, and spends the day and the greater part\nof the night in hymns and prayers to the gods....\")<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(According to Damis,\nthe Brahmans used the earth as a couch, but first strewed it with choice\ngrasses. They walked, too, in the air; Damis saw them. He saw too, the fire\nwhich they drew from the sun's rays, while they worshipped the solar orb. Among\ntheir other miraculous powers were the capacity to cover themselves with clouds\nat will, and to get what they wanted at a moment's notice.. Damis describes\nthese marvelous men as being strict vegetarians, who lived exclusively on fruits\nand vegetables. They were attired in a sleeveless one-piece linen dress;\nwearing no material of animal origin. They wore their hair long, which custom\nthey explained on the basis of the physiological and psychological benefits\nwhich they considered the hair to impart to the brain\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201c And so saying he told\nApollonius who his father was, his mother, all that happened to him at Aegae,\nand how Damis joined him, and what they had said and done on the journey; and\nhe related this so distinctly and fluently, that he might have been a companion\nof their route. Apollonius, greatly astonished, asked him how he knew all\nthis.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"In this\nknowledge,\" he answered, \"You are not wholly wanting, and where you\nare deficient, we will instruct you, for methink it not well to keep secret\nwhat is worthy of being known especially from you, Apollonius -- a man of most\nexcellent memory. And memory, you must know, is of the gods the one we most\nhonor.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"But how do you\nknow my nature?\" asked Apollonius.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"We,\" he\nanswered, \"see into the very soul, tracing out its qualities by a thousand\nsigns. But as midday is at hand, let us to our devotions in which you also may,\nif you will take part.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cApollonius then asked\nIarchus what opinion the Brahmans held of themselves, and was told that they\nheld themselves to be \"gods\"&nbsp;\nbecause they were good men, who knew all things because they first knew\nthemselves.\" Iarchus then told Apollonius his former lives, stating that\nin his [former] life he was an Egyptian sailor\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThe Brahmans then undressed\nand took a bath, after which they put garlands on their heads around their long\nhair, and proceeded to the temple, intent on their hymns. There (quoting\nDamis's account), standing round in a circle, with Iarchus as their leader,\nthey beat the ground with their staves, till bellying like a wave, it sent them\nup into the air about two cubits; and they then sang a hymn, very like the\npaeon of Sophocles sung at Athens to Aesculapius. They then descended to\nearth.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cWhen Apollonius asked\nthe Brahmans whether, since they knew everything, whether they knew themselves,\nthey replied- We know everything just because we begin by knowing ourselves,\nfor no one of us would be admitted to this philosophy unless he first knew\nhimself.\" When Apollonius inquired of Iarchus whether the cosmos was\ncomposed of Four elements, the latter replied that it was made not of four but\nof five, the fifth being the ether. There is, said the Indian sage, \"the\nether, which we must regard as the stuff of which gods are made, for just as\nmortal creatures inhale the air, so do immortal and divine natures inhale the\nether.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On an occasion when he\nwas praising Apollonius for his devotion to mystic lore, Iarchus said, \"My\ngreat friend Apollonius, those who take pleasure in divination [clairvoyance--a\nbyproduct of the awakening of dormant latent spiritual powers in the average\nman] are rendered divine thereby and contribute to the salvation of\nmankind.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThe word\n\"salvation\" embraced for Iarchus both spiritual and physical health,\nfor he declared that among the many blessings which the art of divination\nconferred upon mankind, the gift of healing was the most important, and to this\nart of divination he emphatically attributed \"the credit of discovering\nsimples which healed, in particular of using the virus itself as a cure for\nmany diseases. For I do not think\" he added, \"that men without the\nforecasts of a prophetic wisdom, would ever have ventured to mingle with\nmedicines that save life, those deadly of poisons.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThus we see Iarchus\ninstructing his student, Apollonius of Tyana, in the science of medicine, as he\ninstructed him in astrology and other sciences.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Reville, in his\n\"Apollonius of Tyana, the Pagan Christ of the Third Century,\" writes\nas follows concerning the Brahmans: \"They worshipped fire, which they\nboasted had been brought down directly from the.sun...<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cWith his own eyes,\nDamis saw these sages rise up into the air to the height of two cubits, without\nany extraneous support and without any trickery whatsoever. They wear their\nhair long, have white mitres on their heads, and are clothed in linen garments,\nwoven from a peculiar kind of flax which is only lawful for themselves to\ngather. Their prodigious wisdom overwhelmed even Apollonius, who was not\nfrequently astonished. They are in possession of absolute science; they know at\nonce the past history of every one they see; they can answer all questions.\nWhen asked, \"Who are you?\" they answer, We are `god.' Why? Because we\nare virtuous.\" <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Brahmans were\nfurnished with everything they needed as a spontaneous gift of the earth,\npartaking of fresh vegetables and fruits in season which were brought to them\nby their countrymen dwelling below them.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cApollonius observed\nhis teacher, Iarchus, perform miracles, such as, driving evil spirits out of a\nwoman who was possessed, curing a cripple, restoring sight to a blind man and\nrestoring a man with paralyzed hands to health. He had a high degree of\nclairvoyance, could see at any distance, beheld both past and future, and could\ntell the past lives of those he met\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cApollonius studied\nastrology and the science of divination under Iarchus, for these sessions were\nsecret and to them Damis was not admitted, nor would Apollonius reveal to him\nthe esoteric knowledge then imparted to him by his Himalayan teacher. \u201c<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cOn his departure\nIarchus gave Apollonius Seven rings named after the seven planets, one of which\nwas to be worn on one day of the week; these seven rings would, he said, impart\nhealth and long life. Before parting, Iarchus prophesied that Apollonius would,\neven during his life, attain the honors of a divinity\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThus for several\nmonths Apollonius lived among men who were `gods' in human form, and from them\nhe learned spiritual wisdom which he was destined to later bring back to the\nwest as the basis of a new religion (Christianity) of which he was to be the\nfounder. It was from Iarchus that he received the mission that was to send him\nwandering all his life among the temples of the Mediterranean countries, for\nthe purpose of restoring the ancient mysteries to their former purity\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cWhen he left his\nBrahman master, Apollonius had certain assurance that he would thereafter be in\nconstant telepathic communication with him and receive his guidance and\ninstruction wherever he may be--which later actually was the case \u201c<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"I shall continue\nto speak to you as though you were present,\" Apollonius had said as he\nleft his Indian Masters.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cAs a farewell gift,\nthe Brahman sages, on the threshold of their valley of mediation, gave\nApollonius and Damis camels on which to go suthwards to Muziris from where &nbsp;they continued their journey by water to\nBernice\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cOn his way home,\nApollonius sent the following letter to Iarchus:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Iarchus and the\nother sages, from Apollonius, greetings: I came to you by land; with your aid I\nreturn by sea, and might have returned even by air -- such is the wisdom you\nhave imparted to me.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Even among the\nGreeks I shall not forget these things, and shall still hold commerce with you\n-- or I have indeed vainly drunk of the cup of Tantalus. Farewell, ye best\nphilosophers.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Domitian ascended\nthe throne and began to show the same morbid vanity and cruelty which had\ncharacterized Nero, we find Apollonius traveling up and down the Empire,\nspreading seeds of discontent and rebellion against the crowned monster. To\nDomitian, he fearlessly said, \"I am Apollo's subject not thine.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some of the sayings of\nApollonius against Domitian, the successor of Nero to the throne of Rome, who\nsurpassed even his predecessor in cruelty, having been recorded; we are told\nthat he fell under suspicion through his correspondence with Nerva and his\nassociates Ofitus and Rufus. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When proceedings\nagainst them were begun, Apollonius addressed the following words to the statue\nof Domitian: \"Fool! How little you know of the Fates [Law of Karma] and\nNecessity! He who is destined to reign after you, should you kill him, will\ncome to life again.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Among the charges that\nDomitian made against Apollonius were the following:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Charge lst: &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;With wearing garments which differ from\nthose of other men, thereby attracting crowds of boisterous people to the\ndetriment of the good order of the city. Of wearing the hair long and of living\nnot in accord with good society.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Charge 2nd: &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;With allowing and encouraging men to call\nhim a god.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brought before the\ntribunal, Apollonius disregarded the monarch, and did not even glance at him.\nThe accuser therefore cried out to him to look towards the god of all\nmen,\" whereupon Apollonius raised his eyes to the ceiling<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After his triumphant\ndefense, which he made spontaneously, since he was not permitted to read the\nlong defense he had previously prepared, Domitian &nbsp;asked him to converse with him in private.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Apollonius thanked him, but added the stern\nreproof:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Through the\nwretches who surround you, cities and islands are filled with exiles, the\ncontinent with groans, the armies with cowardice, and the senate with\nsuspicion.\" <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Then he suddenly\ndisappeared from among them<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 200%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-wi9RkNz1bRc/Vwz6byUKUKI/AAAAAAABHZM/X0oTcBktVLcAtKvI4HZSsdz73k_IWCYSACLcB/s1600/hqdefaVult.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-wi9RkNz1bRc/Vwz6byUKUKI/AAAAAAABHZM/X0oTcBktVLcAtKvI4HZSsdz73k_IWCYSACLcB/s640/hqdefaVult.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Damascus Document,\nalso called the Zadokite Fragments, is one of the works found in multiple\nfragmentary copies in the caves at Qumran, and as such is counted among the\nDead Sea Scrolls. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Damascus Document\nis considered by many scholars to be one of the most important sources for\nunderstanding the ancient Essene movement. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Damascus document give\ninsights in the unique character of the Qumran community, the Essene group (\nTHESE UNCIRCUMCISED VEGANS &nbsp;ARE NOT JEWS\n)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The document seems to\nhave been written in stages between 175 B.C.E. and 70 C.E., after which the\ncommunity at Qumran was abandoned. The Damascus Document begin with an\nexhortation to righteousness and speak of the origins of the document's sacred\ncommunity.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It prominently mentions a Teacher of Righteousness and calls on the\ncommunity to adhere strictly to the standards of purity he established. Against\nthis is set the evil teachings of the equally mysterious Man of Mockery (Lies).\nGod is forgiving of those who sin if they change their ways, but \"great\nwrath in flames of fire\" are reserved for those who rebel without repentance.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The text speaks of avoiding three fundamental snares of Belial ( in Malayalam BELAL\n&nbsp;means YOKELESS \u2013 my father used this\nword as a joke on me , when in a good mood ) : fornication, lust for wealth,\nand defiling the Temple. It equates the taking of two wives with fornication,\ndeclaring that: \"The Principle of Creation is 'male and female he created\nthem.'\"&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Equally condemned is the practice of defiling the sacred\nsanctuary, specifically by failing to separate the \"clean from the\nunclean\" and by lying sexually with a women during her menstrual period.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It\nstresses the need for holiness in several other matters as well: avoiding the\nmisuse of offerings and abusing Temple funds, distinguishing between the sacred\nand the profane, refraining from defrauding wealthy widows-- \" One must\nlove one's brother as oneself, support the poor and needy, and give aid to\naliens and strangers\u201d The messiah &nbsp;\"the\nInterpreter of the Law,\" ( KALKI ) will destroy its enemies with the\nsword.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A substantial part of the discourse is devoted to the need to shun the\npromptings of one's own \"willful heart.\" The dictates of the Teacher\nof Righteousness must be upheld and those of the Man of Lies must be rejected.\nThose who repent, even after having failed to keep the sure &nbsp;they made in the land of Damascus,\" will\nbe forgiven. They will ultimately prevail over the \"men of mockery\"\nand all of the inhabitants of the earth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A RULE FOR &nbsp;NAZARENES : Priests must master a document\ncalled the \"Book of Meditation.\"( VEDANTA ) &nbsp;The head priest of each camp or community must\nbe at least 36 years of age. the Essene movement had chapters in several\ncities, as well as a number of camps.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Each camp had its own\n\"overseer\" who served as its teacher, spiritual guide and preacher (\nlike John the Baptist ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SORRY JEWS --</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The document depicts a future\ntime when \"... the sons of light and the lot of darkness shall battle\ntogether for God's might, between the roar of a huge multitude and the shout of\ngods and of men, on the day of the calamity. It will be a time of suffering\nfor BELIALS \". The war itself will be fought in seven rounds. In\nthree, the lot of Belial, will be strongest, in another three the Sons of\nLight. \"And in the seventh lot, God's great hand will subdue.\" (WS-I)\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The battalions are\narmed with swords and spears, encrusted with silver, gold and precious stones.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"They shall line\nup in seven lines ...\" and \"... will hurl against the enemy line\nseven javelins of war.\" (WS-V&amp;VI) <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><i>\"Lord Kalki, the\nLord of the universe, will mount His swift white horse Devadatta and, sword in\nhand, travel over the earth exhibiting His eight mystic opulences and eight\nspecial qualities of Godhead. Displaying His unequaled effulgence and riding\nwith great speed, He will kill by the millions those thieves who have dared\ndress as kings.\"</i></span> (<b><span style=\"color: red;\">Srimad-Bhagavatam 12.2.19-20 5000 BC </span></b>)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As in these battle\nscenes, evolution is played out in cycles of seven \u2013 the seven chakras, the\nseven astral layers, the seven sapt rishis, the seven planets ( leave out rahu\n/ ketu ) used in Panchangam .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Man\u2019s evolution to moksha is by seven steps.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As\neach seven-round cycle of achievement is completed a new one opens ahead. The\n\"weapons\" of evolutionary progress through these cycles of creation\nand destruction are the esoteric science of sound ( seven notes and seven\ncolours ) &nbsp;-- represented here by the\ntrumpets and horns, and the \"cutting sword\" of discrimination --\nsymbolized by the spear and javelins.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; JEW READERS PLEASE STOP THIS.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nThe 'metzitzah b'peh' performed by Orthodox Jews sees the eight-day old baby have a traditional circumcision but the 'mohel' then places his mouth around the wound and sucks up the blood.<br />\n<br />\nMetzitzah b'peh, MEANS \"oral suction circumcisions\"<br />\n<br />\nMost of these perverted mohel SODOMITE priests CUM in their underwear while doing this SUCKING - sorry truth needs to be told--<br />\n<br />\ndont just go by the bible about sodom nd gomorrah or lot and his daughters.<br />\n<br />\n\u201cWe perform all the requirements of circumcision on the Sabbath: We circumcise, uncover, SUCK, and place a compress with cumin on it\u201d (Sabbath 19b).<br />\n<br />\nThe Hebrew word for suck is metzitzah and the SODOMITE enrolled himself to do this job.<br />\n<br />\nIn Mishnah (Shabbat 133b), the 4th century HOMOSEXUAL rabbi Papa of Babylon writes that failure to perform this suction is dangerous for the baby, and any mohel who neglects to perform the ritual should be fired.<br />\n<br />\nTHE TRADITION OF HAVING SUCH GAY PRIESTS CONTINUES IN CHRISTIANITY.<br />\n<br />\nTRUTH IS BITTER.<br />\n<br />\nGOOD JEWS LISTEN UP-- SUCK IS NOT WITH THE MOUTH--IT CAN BE WITH CLEAN SPONGE IN STERILE LINEN.<br />\n<br />\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rLcXvgv4FYI<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_101MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_101BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_101B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_102B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c8255239651741644419\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_102M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/04/most-potent-greenhouse-gases-nitrous.html?showComment=1460478493891#c8255239651741644419\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">April 12, 2016 at 9:58 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_102MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1-<br />\n<br />\nThe identification of Sodom with \"unnatural sexual relations\" originated in Jude 1:6-7:<br />\n\u201c And the angels which kept not their first estate, but left their own habitation, he hath reserved in everlasting chains under darkness unto the judgment of the great day. 7 Even as Sodom and Gomorrha, and the cities about them in like manner, giving themselves over to fornication, and going after strange flesh, are set forth for an example, suffering the vengeance of eternal fire \u201c<br />\n<br />\nWhile \"sodomy\" carries a strong connotation of sexual acts between persons of the same sex, the meaning is not restricted to only this type of sexual act. As defined in Noah Webster's 1828 English Dictionary, \"SOD'OMY, noun [is] A crime against nature.\" The broadness of the term served as a blanket condemnation of all types of sexual behaviors performed outside the scope of procreation between a man and a woman<br />\n<br />\nSODOMITES refers to people engaged in all sorts of SEXUAL perversions.<br />\n<br />\nIn England when King Henry VIII becme PROTESTANT he ruled that \u201csodomy\u201d should be became a civil offense --and he pushed the passage of the buggery Act of 1533.<br />\n<br />\nANAL SEX WAS RAMPANT IN CATHOLIC MONASTRIES SO THAT UNMARRIED NUNDS O NOT BECOME PREGNANT. THE CATHOLIC PRIESTS SHOSE MARRIED WOMEN FOR VAGINAL SEX .<br />\n<br />\nFor several hundreds of years, ALL considered homosexuality something a person did and called it sodomy, buggery, or a crime against nature. During the nineteenth century, a conceptual shift occurred, rothschild JEW media began to talk about homosexuality as something a person was-like being left handed.<br />\n<br />\n\"THIN UPPER LIPPED \" ARUN JAITLEY AND APCO BRANDED MODI WILL AGREE WITH THESE PERVERTED JEWS.<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_103b+seedB7IID\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_103b+seedB7IID\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c5547614151552474215\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_114M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/03914532014759510705\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Words are magic</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/04/most-potent-greenhouse-gases-nitrous.html?showComment=1460485635671#c5547614151552474215\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">April 12, 2016 at 11:57 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_114MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCaptain do you know about Arthur Koestler. , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>WHEN YOUR ( YOUR SOULs ) &nbsp;KARMIC BAGGAGE IS LESSER YOU CLIMB HIGHER -- YOU EVOLVE -- YOU ARE PURIFIED.</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: blue;
